intro: Schistostephium artemisiifolium, commonly known as blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and hairy foliage. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a silvery-blue appearance due to dense pubescence. Schistostephium artemisiifolium is also known for its small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators.
